1.text: These are the proverbs of Solomon son of David, king of Israel,

2.text: for gaining wisdom and discipline, for comprehending words of insight,

3.text: and for receiving instruction in wise living and in righteousness, justice, and equity.

4.text: To impart prudence to the simple and knowledge and discretion to the young,

5.text: let the wise listen and gain instruction, and the discerning acquire wise counsel

6.text: by understanding the proverbs and parables, the sayings and riddles of the wise.

7.text: The fear of the LORD is the beginning of knowledge, but fools despise wisdom and discipline.

8.text: Listen, my son, to your father’s instruction, and do not forsake the teaching of your mother.

9.text: For they are a garland of grace on your head and a pendant around your neck.

10.text: My son, if sinners entice you, do not yield to them.

11.text: If they say, “Come along, let us lie in wait for blood, let us ambush the innocent without cause,

12.text: let us swallow them alive like Sheol, and whole like those descending into the Pit.

13.text: We will find all manner of precious goods; we will fill our houses with plunder.

14.text: Throw in your lot with us; let us all share one purse”—

15.text: my son, do not walk the road with them or set foot upon their path.

16.text: For their feet run to evil, and they are swift to shed blood.

17.text: How futile it is to spread the net where any bird can see it!

18.text: But they lie in wait for their own blood; they ambush their own lives.

19.text: Such is the fate of all who are greedy, whose unjust gain takes the lives of its possessors.

20.text: Wisdom calls out in the street, she lifts her voice in the square;

21.text: in the main concourse she cries aloud, at the city gates she makes her speech:

22.text: “How long, O simple ones, will you love your simple ways? How long will scoffers delight in their scorn and fools hate knowledge?

23.text: If you had repented at my rebuke, then surely I would have poured out my spirit on you; I would have made my words known to you.

24.text: Because you refused my call, and no one took my outstretched hand,

25.text: because you neglected all my counsel, and wanted none of my correction,

26.text: in turn I will mock your calamity; I will sneer when terror strikes you,

27.text: when your dread comes like a storm, and your destruction like a whirlwind, when distress and anguish overwhelm you.

28.text: Then they will call on me, but I will not answer; they will earnestly seek me, but will not find me.

29.text: For they hated knowledge and chose not to fear the LORD.

30.text: They accepted none of my counsel; they despised all my reproof.

31.text: So they will eat the fruit of their own way, and be filled with their own devices.

32.text: For the waywardness of the simple will slay them, and the complacency of fools will destroy them.

33.text: But whoever listens to me will dwell in safety, secure from the fear of evil.”
